title: Site & Engineering Leader till Carmeda
description:
Är du intresserad av att arbeta på ett företag med familjär stämning och unika produkter? Vill du få möjligheten att utvecklas inom ett kompetent och tryggt team? Då kan denna roll som Site & Engineering Leader på Carmeda passa perfekt!
 



  





**Om Carmeda** 




 På Carmeda är vi ett prestigelöst team som inte tvekar att ta ansvar och driva arbetet framåt. Vi värdesätter hjälpsamhet och lyhördhet samtidigt som vi gillar att ha roligt tillsammans. Här erbjuds du en arbetsmiljö med stort ansvar och goda möjligheter att påverka, skapa och bygga företagets framtid tillsammans med engagerade och handlingskraftiga kollegor. Vill du vara med och utvecklas med oss?
 



  





 Carmeda är ett medicintekniskt bolag inom området för biomaterial. Företaget är ett helägt dotterbolag till W. L. Gore & Associates, Inc. och har cirka 50 medarbetare. Verksamhetens fokus ligger på att förbättra livskvalitén för människor genom att forska, utveckla och producera biokompatibla ytbeläggningar för medicintekniska produkter med blodkontakt. Carmeda sitter i nya och fina lokaler i Ulriksdal. Här blir du en del av en trevlig arbetsplats med kompetenta medarbetare och trygga ledare. Företaget erbjuder en välfungerande och stabil arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar. Du får också möjlighet till frihet, eget ansvar och personlig utveckling.
 



  





**Din nya roll** 




 I rollen som Site & Engineering Leader kommer du att ha det övergripande tekniska ansvaret för att samordna och vidareutveckla det operativa driftarbetet, med målsättning att ha avbrottsfri och effektiv produktion och kvalitativ fastighetsdrift. Du kommer att ansvara för ett operativt driftteam på Carmeda men också samverka med externa partners, varför rollen kräver ett gott sinne för samarbete och lyhördhet.
 



  





 Rollen innebär:
 


* Strategisk planering av sitens kapacitet för att kunna driva produktionen.
* Proaktivt arbete med underhåll.
* Utföra utvärderingar för att förhindra driftstopp och identifiera riskbaserade åtgärder för att minska och eliminera driftstopp.
* Kontinuerligt arbete för att få djupare systemkunskap.
* Planera och utföra alla aktiviteter med ett brett hållbarhetsfokus.
* Samarbeta med R&D och Business Development Leader gällande laboratorieinfrastrukturbehov.
* Förhandla och förnya avtal och kontraktsförpliktelser relaterade till Site & Engineering-frågor i samarbete med Operations Leader.
* Utföra alla aktiviteter enligt Carmedas kvalitetsledningssystem.
* Säkerställa att alla aktiviteter bedrivs effektivt med avseende på kostnader, miljöpåverkan och tidsanvändning.
* Personalansvar för fyra anställda inom Site & Engineering-avdelningen.



 Du kommer också att samarbeta med Operations Unit Leader gällande:
 


* Rekrytering och onboarding.
* Driva förändring och identifiera utvecklingsmöjligheter inom verksamheten.
* Kultur och engagemang.



  





**För att lyckas väl i rollen** 




 Krävs att du:
 


* Har högskoleingenjörsutbildning inom relevant område såsom industri, produktion eller fastighetsteknik alternativt motsvarande erfarenhet som gör dig väl lämpad för rollen.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av teknisk drift, process- eller tillverkningsindustri eller inom fastighetsbranschen och med dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda liknande arbete.
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap inom fastighet eller industrin, gärna i en produktions- eller underhållsmiljö.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av fastighetstekniska system för el, VVS, ventilation, styr- och övervakning.
* Behärskar engelska och svenska – flytande i tal och skrift.



  





 Du behöver ha:
 


* God IT- och administrationsvana kopplat till ett digitalt arbetssätt.
* Erfarenhet av formellt personalansvar.



  





 Du har också nytta av:
 


* ISO13485-erfarenhet.
* Kunskap inom entreprenadjuridik och fastighetsstandarder.
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap i en reglerad produktions- eller underhållsmiljö.



  





 Som person är du:
 


* Driven, och agerar proaktivt
* Kommunikativ, med en förmåga att uttrycka dig tydligt och kunna anpassa stil och innehåll till olika situationer, mål och målgrupper.
* Fokuserad på kundens/organisationens behov, såväl internt som externt.
* En naturlig och trygg ledare.
* En relationsbyggare – du har god förmåga att bygga och bibehålla goda samarbeten samt skapa goda relationer såväl internt som externt.



  





**Vad erbjuder vi** 



* En produkt som förbättrar livskvalitén för människor.
* En familjär känsla i det lilla bolaget med korta beslutsvägar och med en spännande tid framför sig.
* En inspirerande miljö med moderna och funktionella lokaler samt kompetenta och trevliga kollegor.



  





**Vad gör du nu?** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Carmeda med Hays. Är du intresserad av rollen så ansöker du med en uppdaterad CV samt personligt brev. Vid specifika frågor kring rollen kontaktar du ansvarig rekryterare Linus Norrbom, linus.norrbom@hays.com eller Lorelai Morariu, lorelai.morariu@hays.com. Ansökningar behandlas löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan!

title: AP/AR Associate
description:
We are on a mission to become the leading force in residential property management services. The global residential property management industry is currently undergoing a digital transformation and Odevo is at the forefront of this transformation. Our mission is to radically simplify living for families and individuals by delivering highly attractive and efficient property management services to building owners and associations as well as to residents. Our core belief is that digital technology combined with great people will play a central role in delivering a step change in how boards and residents experience property management.
   

  

 What we do matters to billions of people across the world. Residential real estate is the world’s largest asset class and buying a home is often the biggest investment a person or family will ever make. But the residential property management industry is lagging behind when it comes to customer focus and digitalization. That is why we formed Odevo.
   

  

 Leading property management companies in the Nordics, UK, Germany and US have already joined forces to form Odevo and over the last 4 years Odevo’ s revenues have grown 40-fold to become a leading international player. Our ambition is to continue to grow rapidly organically and by attracting additional companies to join us in both existing and new markets.
   

  

 We deliver our property management services with custom developed software to simplify living and make life easier for property owners, association boards, residents and very importantly our own property management professionals. We make complex topics such as managing property finances and the daily maintenance of buildings easy, and we automate time-consuming everyday tasks so people can spend more time on things that they really enjoy.
   

  

 We are a 7000 employee company with a start-up mentality. We aspire to break new ground through innovation, and we actively cultivate a workplace where we can grow as individuals and have fun while achieving great things together.
   

  

 To continue our ambitious growth journey, we are now looking for people who share our vision to join us on a journey that will continue to transform the property management industry on a global scale.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking an ambitious professional to join our Group Finance team in a role with high potential, working closely with the Group Finance team. In this position, you will help shape and advance the Finance function, collaborating with the Accounting Manager and the Head of Financial Control.
   

  

 As an AR/AP Associate, your main responsibility will be to solely manage and improve accounts receivable/payable processes. You will, together with the Accounting Manager, be responsible for the month-end-close focusing on AP/AR processes, bank account reconciliation, disbursements and allocation of expenses in the right departments.
   

  

 Your ambitious mindset combined with accuracy and timeliness will be essential in building a smooth and well-functioning AP/AR process that adapts to the needs of our rapidly growing group.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Managing the AP/AR processes from start to end, ensuring revenue and expenses are paid on time, treated correctly and allocated to the right dimension.
* Collaborating with the Accounting Manager for system related questions, ensuring we have the most efficient software to support our growth.
* Support the Accounting Manager with month-end-close processes, balance sheet account reconciliations such as bank accounts,
* Coordinating with suppliers and customers, as well as shared functions throughout the group ensures we handle the AP/AR process the most efficient way.


**Who You Are**
 You are an unpretentious and socially skilled team player who thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. You thrive in a role where you can take initiative and ensure that things get done. You possess a problem-solving mindset and are eager to learn. Given the growth of the Odevo Group there are a lot of opportunities to grow within this role.
   

  

**Experience**
 While sharing our values and being excited about our journey is important, we believe that experience in the following areas will contribute to success in this role:
   

  

* Accounts payable/Accounts receivable experience are highly desirable (at least 2 years in a similar role).
* Experience in Excel is essential for success in this role.
* Bachelor's degree holder in Accounting, Finance or other relevant degree, professional certification is an advantage.


**Excited?**
 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, apply for this position!
   

  

 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
   

  

 🔍 About Odevo
   

  

 🌐 Our Software

title: Inside Sales - Bli en Nyckelspelare i Vårt Säljteam! (Remote)
description:
Inside Sales - Bli en Nyckelspelare i Vårt Säljteam!
   

  

**Ansvarsområden:**
* Hantera Befintliga Kunder: Bygg och underhåll starka relationer med våra nuvarande kunder för att säkerställa deras nöjdhet och lojalitet. Ditt fokus kommer att vara att förstå deras behov och proaktivt erbjuda lösningar.
* Engagera och vårda leads: Du kommer att spela en central roll i att identifiera och kvalificera potentiella kunder genom kreativ och analytisk research via telefon, e-post och sociala medier. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla och implementera strategier för att engagera och vårda leads, med fokus på att attrahera och inspirera intresse för våra produkter och tjänster. Din förmåga att kommunicera effektivt och skapa intresse är avgörande för att lyckas i denna roll.
* Säljsupport: Du kommer att vara en viktig länk mellan våra kunder och våra erbjudanden. Detta genom att bland annat förbereda offerter och hantera avtal, och licenshantering. Din noggrannhet och organisatoriska förmåga kommer att vara ovärderlig.
* Rapportering och Analys: Följ upp kampanjresultat och dela insikter med ledningen för att ständigt förbättra våra processer och strategier.


 Är du en hungrig och ambitiös person som vill ta din karriär till nästa nivå? COSMO söker nu en
 **Inside Sales** 
 -representant som är redo att göra skillnad! I denna spännande roll kommer du att vara en central del av vårt säljteam och bidra till vår framgång genom att:
   

  

**Ansvarsområden:**
* Hantera Befintliga Kunder: Bygg och underhåll starka relationer med våra nuvarande kunder för att säkerställa deras nöjdhet och lojalitet. Ditt fokus kommer att vara att förstå deras behov och proaktivt erbjuda lösningar.
* Engagera och vårda leads: Du kommer att spela en central roll i att identifiera och kvalificera potentiella kunder genom kreativ och analytisk research via telefon, e-post och sociala medier. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla och implementera strategier för att engagera och vårda leads, med fokus på att attrahera och inspirera intresse för våra produkter och tjänster. Din förmåga att kommunicera effektivt och skapa intresse är avgörande för att lyckas i denna roll.
* Säljsupport: Du kommer att vara en viktig länk mellan våra kunder och våra erbjudanden. Detta genom att bland annat förbereda offerter och hantera avtal, och licenshantering. Din noggrannhet och organisatoriska förmåga kommer att vara ovärderlig.
* Rapportering och Analys: Följ upp kampanjresultat och dela insikter med ledningen för att ständigt förbättra våra processer och strategier.


**Kvalifikationer:**
* Utbildning: Universitet eller yrkeskvalificerad utbildning inom finans, marknadsföring eller IT.
* Erfarenhet: Några års erfarenhet inom försäljning. Du har en bevisad förmåga att nå och överträffa försäljningsmål. Har du erfarenhet av att ha arbetet med Affärssystem eller CRM-system är detta meriterande.
* Språk: Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
* Personliga Egenskaper: Du är social, energisk och har en förmåga att skapa relationer med kunder. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö och är inte rädd för att ta initiativ. Vi söker en "alltiallo"-person som är driven och redo att ta ansvar för vår go-to-market strategi.


**Varför COSMO?**
 Bli en del av COSMO och hjälp oss att driva vår expansion och go-to-market strategi framåt! Här får du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en stimulerande och stödjande miljö. Det är att föredra om du bor på någon av oreterna Göteborg eller Malmö. Vi värdesätter innovation och initiativ, och vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Skicka in din ansökan idag och bli en del av vårt framgångsrika team!**
 Vi är också unika.
   

  

 Det är det som skiljer oss åt:
   

  

* Hos oss är alla en del av teamet - din röst behövs, även när det gäller vår egen företagsutveckling.
* Det är viktigt för oss att du känner dig uppskattad och stödd.
* Platsoberoende och flexibelt arbete är en självklarhet för oss. I rollen ingår det att kontinuerligt besöka något av våra kontor runt om i Sverige; Stockholm, Malmö och Göteborg.
* Internationellt samarbete är vardag för oss - upptäck andra kulturer och nya världar.
* En säker och positiv arbetsmiljö är vår högsta prioritet.
* Vi har omvandling i blodet - vi står inte stilla.
* Det ligger oss varmt om hjärtat att tillsammans med dig utforma din fortsatta utveckling.
* Hos oss är det möjligt att göra olika och ovanliga karriärer.
* Vi tar vårt ansvar för människor och miljö på allvar.


 Do you want to become part of the team?
   

  

 Apply directly online with your informative application documents and your earliest possible start date.
   

  

 Do you want more #insideCOSMO?

title: Account Manager, Customer Connect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Financial Services
description:
**Position Summary**
 This position is responsible for maintaining deep customer relationships to drive account revenue retention and growth. By collaborating with internal partners, the Account Manager delivers exceptional service and a valuable solution. The position will manage a defined book of business aligned by customer segment within a geography and will be accountable for the commercial close of all deals. You will also open up larger solution opportunities and introduce Solution and Proposition Sales.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
* Demonstrate deep understanding of the customer decision maker’s strategies, priorities and needs
* Maintain solid knowledge of Refinitiv propositions to initiate conversations and raise interest
* Build and embed a long-term trusted advisor relationship within assigned accounts
* Drive growth by expanding Refinitiv footprint within their accounts
* Focus on maintaining overall customer engagement and expanding and retaining managed net revenue
* Lead all commercial activities within accounts, owning the end to end customer relationship
* Drive efficiency in account administration (especially for lower value and growth potential accounts)
* Manage internal and external partners and maintain networks to negotiate and close deals
* Accountable and responsible for simple order taking


 Emerging & Growth Model
   

  

* Manage an assigned Growth accounts book on a proactive basis
* Account Managers may also manage a pooled book of accounts on a reactive basis
* All Account Managers in Emerging and Growth segments are in charge of sales, revenue retention, and administration of their accounts


**Qualifications And Experience Required**
* Strong understanding of customers and their business model and workflows
* Prior financial sector experience within the customer segment
* Strong product knowledge
* Relationship building skills
* Sophisticated selling skills (identity, develop and articulate a complex proposition/consultative selling)
* Strong negotiation skills
* Superior interpersonal skills, ability to develop and execute a sales plan, ability to use a variety of technology with a high level of proficiency
* Problem solving skills: ability to understand, articulate, structure and solve client needs
* Presentation and communication skills: ability to deliver presentations and communicate at all levels within an organization
* Ability to collaborate with other team
* University/college degree, equivalent experience may be considered depending on position/department, advanced degree may be preferred
* Significant work experience in applicable industry and knowledge of customer workflow required
* Proven account management, sales or marketing experience in a customer facing environment required
* Customer relationship management required across various levels within matrix


 LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
   

  

 Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of
 **Integrity, Partnership** 
 ,
 **Excellence** 
 and
 **Change** 
 underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
   

  

 Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
   

  

 LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
   

  

 We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.
   

  

 Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject.
   

  

 If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Observability / OpenTelemetry Agent
description:
The Datadog Agent is software that runs on customer infrastructure and supports a wide range of platforms. It efficiently collects observability data from millions of hosts and sends them to Datadog, where our customers can analyze their monitoring and performance data. OpenTelemetry (OTel) is an open source, vendor-neutral observability solution that allows teams to monitor their applications and services in a standardized format.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer who will help us ensure that OpenTelemetry users deploying the open-source Datadog Agent can get access to all of Datadog's industry-leading observability solutions and can continue to leverage OpenTelemetry-specific capabilities (via the embedded OTel Collector). Come join us to unlock new observability capabilities across millions of Agents, for technical customers who care deeply about what you build.
   

  

*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*
**What You’ll Do:**
* Develop high-performance OTel observability pipelines in the Datadog Agent, running on customers’ infrastructures and targeting a large number of platforms / environments / deployment models, with Datadog-specific and upstream OpenTelemetry contributions
* Simplify customers’ onboarding and management of OTel pipelines with Fleet Management capabilities
* Review community contributions to Datadog-related components of OTel
* Take part in investigating and fixing issues with the internal production deployment of the Datadog Agent
* With your team, be a driving force in product decisions and plan the most important projects to work on next


**Who You Are:**
* You have been building software for 5+ years and know the systems you’ve worked on from top to bottom
* You have significant experience in one or more programming languages such as Go, Java, Rust, .NET or C/C++
* You value code simplicity and performance
* You are data driven and use observability products
* You want to work in a fast, high-growth environment that respects its engineers and customers
* You are motivated by solving problems for our customers


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**Bonus Points:**
* You have experience building and shipping packaged or downloadable software
* You are familiar with OpenTelemetry
* You have contributed to or have an official role in Open Source projects
* You have significant experience in using profilers, debuggers, tracers, or similar tools to improve the code quality of the software you’re writing


**Benefits and Growth:**
* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
* An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)
* Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions
* Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+
* Competitive global benefits


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*
**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Bid Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking an experienced and proactive Bid Manager to join our Growth team in the Nordics. The location can be Copenhagen, Malmö, Gothenburg, or Stockholm, where we have our offices. This role plays a crucial role in driving the success of our proposals and growth process by securing new key client contracts and supporting the Nordic Business Development Lead and Client Partners by managing the proposal process for the market. The role ensures that all sales activities are well-executed and that proposals are compelling, accurate, and timely. The role requires a blend of strategic thinking, attention to detail, and excellent communication skills. The Bid Manager will report directly into the Senior Director, Business Development Lead in Copenhagen and will be aligned to the Nordic ‘Sales & Leadership’ team.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* End-to-End Bid Management: Proven ability to manage the entire bid lifecycle, including planning, execution, and post-submission reviews, ensuring alignment with client expectations and organizational goals.
* Technical and Commercial Expertise: A strong understanding of IT solutions, technologies, and services, combined with the ability to clearly articulate their commercial and technical value to clients. Additionally, the capability to explain Sapient s comparative advantage within the competitive landscape.
* Proposal Development Skills: Expertise in writing, reviewing, and editing high-quality proposals, ensuring compliance with client requirements and adherence to organisational standards.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Demonstrated success in coordinating with internal teams, such as sales, technical experts, and legal teams, to develop cohesive and competitive bids.
* Client-Focused Approach: Ability to analyse client needs and tailor proposals to meet their unique challenges and objectives, ensuring a customer-centric narrative.
* Regulatory Compliance: Familiarity with public and private procurement frameworks, particularly in the European market, ensuring adherence to all relevant regulations and standards.
* Strong Communication Skills: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to clearly convey complex ideas and create compelling presentations. Proficiency in at least one Scandiavian language is a strong advantage.
* Deadline and Quality Management: Ability to manage multiple bids simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines, without compromising the quality and accuracy of deliverables.
* Risk Assessment: Proficiency in identifying and mitigating risks associated with bids, ensuring alignment with the organisation’s risk tolerance and strategic goals.
* Budget and Resource Planning: Experience in managing bid budgets and resources effectively, optimizing costs without compromising on proposal quality.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Skilled in using data and analytics to assess bid performance, identify areas for improvement, and refine future strategies.
* Market Awareness: Strong understanding of market trends, competitor strategies, and client expectations within the IT industry.
* Attention to Detail: Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring all proposals are accurate, persuasive, and compliant with client specifications.
* Adaptability: Proven ability to thrive in dynamic, high-pressure environments, adapting quickly to changing priorities and challenges.
* Tool Proficiency: Hands-on experience with bid management tools, collaboration platforms, and documentation systems to streamline processes.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Benefits Of Working Here**
* Hybrid working model and flexible working hours.
* Strong people first company culture.
* Numerous learning opportunities to support your professional growth.
* Amazing opportunities for career progression.
* Staff incentives and rewards schemes.
* Company pension plan and occupational disability insurance.
* Discounts on travel, culture, and leisure activities.
* “Work Your World Program” – every Publicis Sapient employee is entitled to work anywhere in the world for up to 6 weeks every year.


**Company Description**
 Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting, and customer obsession to accelerate our client s businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.

title: Stiftskyrkovaktmästare med värdskap i S:t Jacob kyrka
description:
**Stiftskyrkovaktmästare med värdskap i Sankt Jacobs kyrka**
 Vill du bli stiftskyrkovaktmästare i Sankt Jacobs kyrka och Jacobsgården? Nu förstärker vi teamet med en vaktmästartjänst till. Denna nya tjänst på Stockholms stiftskansli har fokus på värdskap och service i en verksamhet som delvis är under utveckling. Om du är en person med stor initiativkraft och entusiasm för ett välkomnande bemötande, så är det här tjänsten för dig!
   

  

 I Stockholms stift finns en mångfald av kulturell bakgrund, religionsutövning, sociala förhållanden, samlevnadsformer och kulturutbud. Stiftets uppgift är att främja församlingarnas verksamhet på olika sätt, förvalta stiftets egendomar och utöva tillsyn över att evangelium förkunnas klart i stiftets församlingar. Här finns drygt 60 anställda som arbetar i aktivitetsbaserat kontor i nyrenoverade Jacobsgården, invid Sankt Jacobs kyrka vid Kungsträdgården i centrala Stockholm. Sankt Jacobs kyrka ägs numer av stiftet och är under renovering med återöppning i december 2025.
   

  

 OM TJÄNSTEN
   

  

 Tjänsten är blandad och ingen dag kommer att vara den andra lik. Eftersom rollen som stiftskyrkovaktmästare är nyinrättad finns det stora möjligheter för rätt person att själv vara med och utforma dess innehåll.
   

  

 Värdskapet för Sankt Jacobs kyrka är centralt och du blir del i ett team som tillsammans ansvarar för att kyrkorummet är välkomnande och tryggt för besökare och samarbetspartners. Du inbjuds att bidra med lösningar till de praktiska eller logistiska utmaningar som kommer med en mångsidig verksamhet i kyrkorummet, och relaterar till många olika aktörer. Kyrkans historiska lokaler medför att tjänsten innehåller både lyft och trappor i trånga utrymmen. Värdskapet innebär att arbetsuppgifterna varierar efter behov och tempot kan stundtals vara högt. Viss tjänstgöring under kvällar och helger ingår.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Vara värd och kontaktperson vid evenemang och konferenser för att säkerställa en god upplevelse för deltagare och arrangörer.
* Ansvara för lokalernas iordningsställande inför olika aktiviteter, inklusive möblering, teknik och dekoration, samt vara kontakt mot städ och förvaltare.
* Samverka med kollegor, ideella och externa samarbetspartners för att planera och genomföra aktiviteter.
* Bidra med lösningar vid praktiska problem samt säkerställa att lokalerna är rena, säkra och välkomnande.
* Underhålla och sköta vår kyrkobyggnad och tillhörande lokaler, inklusive enklare skötsel av kyrkliga inventarier.
* Kyrkvaktmästare vid gudstjänster och andakter i kyrkan.


 Rollen svarar också för kontorsservice till stiftskansliet i Jacobsgården. I den delen ingår posthantering, reception och emottagande, facility management, logistik och underhåll och annan intern service.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsplats med varierande arbetsuppgifter i en vacker miljö i centrala Stockholm, tillsammans med många engagerade medarbetare. Stockholms stift präglas av ett dynamiskt och drivkraftigt arbetssätt där varje anställd tar stort ansvar för sin del i en gemensam helhet. Det finns en medvetenhet om att vi medarbetare är varandras arbetsmiljö. I rollen får du möjlighet att bidra till både andlig och kulturell utveckling i samhället.
   

  

 OM DIG
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är serviceinriktad med en positiv attityd, lösningsorienterad och idérik. Du har erfarenhet från rollen som kyrkvaktmästare och kanske även från event och service, värdskap eller praktiskt arbete kopplat till evenemang och lokalvård. Du har god social förmåga och trivs med att möta människor och samarbeta i team. Samtidigt känner du stort eget ansvar och tar initiativ när du ser ett behov. Du är praktiskt lagd med ett gott öga för estetik och detaljer, och kan prioritera uppgifter för att skapa ordning och reda. Du är lyhörd för kyrkorummets särskilda förutsättningar och kanske har du liksom vi, intresse för historia och kulturarv. I rekryteringen läggs stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

 Att arbeta i Svenska kyrkan innebär att arbeta för något man tror på. Vi förutsätter att du är medlem i Svenska kyrkan och delar våra värderingar som kännetecknas av varje människas lika värde, arbete för fred, försoning, rättvisa och hållbarhet. Läs mer om vår värdegrund här.
   

  

 KOMPETENSKRAV
   

  

* Gymnasial utbildning
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet från rollen som kyrkvaktmästare
* Erfarenhet eller utbildning inom till exempel event, turism och service eller facility management är meriterande
* Uttrycker sig väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift, ytterligare språk är meriterande
* Goda datorkunskaper, särskilt inom Microsoft 365
* Baskunskap inom teknisk utrustning (ljud, bild och IT) är meriterande


 Sista ansökningsdag: 21 april
   

  

 Intervjuer kommer att ske den 29 april
   

  

 Tillträde:  1 september eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning med 6 mån provanställning
   

  

 Placering: Jacobsgården bredvid Sankt Jacobs kyrka i centrala Stockholm
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Leena Seim Lepik, verksamhetsansvarig, mail: leena.seim@svenskakyrkan.se, tel: 08-50894058
   

  

 Facklig företrädare:
   

  

 Oskar Johnsson, Vision, mail: oskar.johnsson@svenskakyrkan.se, tel: 08-50894037
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/217 | Publicerat: 2025-04-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-21

title: Territory Sales Manager, Surgical Technologies | Greater Stockholm & North of Sweden
company_industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
**The Job’s Mission:**
 As
 **Territory Sales Manager** 
 , you will help us deliver on our mission of making healthcare better by promoting and selling Stryker’s
 **Surgical Technologies** 
 product portfolio. On average,
 **most of your time in this position will be in the Greater Stockholm area (60-70%)** 
 . The other portion of your time will be covering the
 **North of Sweden** 
 .
   

  

 In this role, you will pursue opportunities to grow our Surgical Technologies business, while demonstrating exemplary customer and patient focus.
 **This is a great opportunity to join one of the world’s leading medical technology organizations, make an impact, grow and develop further** 
 !
   

  

**About Stryker Surgical Technologies:**
 Stryker’s Surgical Technologies business focus on improving the safety of healthcare professionals and their patients while also helping hospitals reduce their ecological footprint. Some examples of our innovative portfolio are:
   

  

* SafeAir: Studies indicate that nurses have twice the incidence of respiratory problems compared with the general population – and inhale an equivalent of 27 cigarettes in an 8-hour day in the operating room. Stryker’s SafeAir products help to reduce the exposure of healthcare professionals and their patients to surgical smoke (and its chemical, carcinogenic hazards). Find out more about SafeAir: https://www.safeor.com/products/smokeevacuation
* Neptune collects, transports and disposes of surgical waste fluid helping protect healthcare professionals from exposure whilst increasing efficiencies in the operating room. Find out more about Neptune: https://www.safeor.com/products/neptune and https://www.safeor.com/products/neptune-s
* Hear the story of Julie Greenhalgh and the impact of our solutions to healthcare professionals in the operating room: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZeFzYpXots


**What you will do:**
* In your new role, you will start with a familiarization phase with product trainings to learn about our product portfolio and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Prospect new customers, understand their needs, while also providing ongoing service to existing customers: fostering trust relationships and customer loyalty.
* Plan and implement strategies in the sales process and conduct negotiations including with hospital professionals, purchasing departments, etc.
* With the product knowledge you’ll develop, you will inform, advise and train hospital professionals also during demonstrations.
* Prepare orders for interested customers and be a reliable partner for our customers also during order follow-up and after-sales.
* Participate congresses, seminars and business meetings to identify potential new customers and to expand your knowledge for customer contact.
* Work closely with Surgical Technologies team members and also with peers of other divisions of Stryker towards cross-departmental opportunities.


**What you need:**
 Required:
   

  

* 4+ years of experience.
* Degree or equivalent.
* Excellent interpersonal communications and persuasion skills – with proficiency in Swedish and English.
* Relationship skills: you appreciate contact with a wide variety of people and enjoy building and maintaining connections. You also consider yourself a great team player.
* You are enthusiastic about (medical) technology – your resilience and desire to sell technical products with the best customer service are important elements to you.
* You demonstrate adaptability, organizational and analytical skills.
* You have a valid driver’s license as this position involves regular customer visits.


 Preferred:
   

  

* Sales experience with capital devices/equipment is not mandatory, but it would be an advantage.
* Sales experience in industries such as MedTech, BioTech, healthcare or related is not mandatory, but it would be a plus.


**What we offer:**
* Flat hierarchies and a culture committed to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results.
* We grow talent: we offer great personal and internal career development for our employees, with the possibility to make both vertical and lateral position movement.
* An attractive salary and benefits package including company car, an attractive pension plan, etc.
* Recognition of your performance: at Stryker, outstanding individual and cross-functional team performance is rewarded. Ideas, projects, or other exceptional achievements can be submitted for various awards on a local and global level.
* Collaborative and inclusive environment: join a team that values diversity and inclusion, fostering a supportive and innovative workplace.
* Quality products that improve the lives of our customers and patients.
* Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your career.


 Stryker is a global leader in medical technologies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually.

title: Site Reliability Engineer - Cassandra
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.


Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analyzed. Tink handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what Tink engineers are doing.


What we are looking for:


We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Stateful team. Working from our office in Stockholm and help us maintain, expand and evolve our Cassandra database offering.


The Stateful team is the backbone of our data infrastructure and tooling. Playing a vital role in delivering essential database services and developing tools to meet the evolving needs of the Tink organization. We are actively expanding our team, seeking talented Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) and DevOps engineers who can bring their expertise to drive our database services to new heights.


What we offer you:


A position in the Stateful team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:

* Ensuring scalability and reliability of our most critical operational data store. Primarily Cassandra.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the database services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.


This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

 **Qualifications**  

Basic Qualification  

* 5+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years


of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0  

years of work experience with a PhD, OR 8+ years of relevant work experience.  

* Proven experience in managing Cassandra databases at scale.
* A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
* Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog


  

Preferred Qualification  

* 6 or more years of work experience with a Bachelors Degree or 4 or more years


of relevant experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or  

up to 3 years of relevant experience with a PhD  

* Familiarity with AWS, RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB, Zookeeper, and Kafka
* Extensive industry experience, including mentoring of junior engineers.
 **Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of cloud architecture for smart lock systems?
Technology Solutions, part of the Americas Division, develops global modular platforms for smart lock systems, enabling group-wide reuse within ASSA ABLOY. To strengthen our capabilities, we are looking for a Cloud Architect to oversee our cloud infrastructure, ensure best practices for CI/CD, and drive scalable and secure cloud solutions. Join our team and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
The cloud architect will be responsible for Technology Solutions B2B cloud infrastructure, internal devops infrastructure and works closely with the software teams to make sure that we have a secure, scalable cloud architecture in place. The architect will work closely with the different teams within Technology Solutions and need to be able to travel to our different sites. I.e. Stockholm, Krakow and within Americas.  

**What you will do as our Cloud Architect**
As a Cloud Architect, you will be responsible for CI/CD and devops best practices including the complete software build chain within Technology Solutions; CI – Continuous integration, CD – Continuous deployment and standardisation of tools and third party frameworks. A special focus area is CI/CD for embedded systems including hardware in the loop testing and hardware emulation. Moreover, you will be designing and supporting the implementation of cloud architectures across AWS and Azure to support business applications and workloads. You will ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and scalability while enforcing security best practices, policies, and procedures. Your role will involve conducting security risk assessments, implementing security controls, and managing identity and access management (IAM) in alignment with compliance frameworks such as ISO, NIST, and SOC2. Additionally, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop secure, efficient, and automated cloud solutions.
You would also:
* Monitor system performance, security, and cost optimizations using cloud-native tools and third-party solutions.
* Implement containerization and orchestration solutions (Docker, Kubernetes) to streamline application deployments.
* Provide mentorship and guidance to teams on cloud security, DevOps, and best architectural practices.
* Define CI/CD best practices and implement DevOps pipelines, CI/CD automation, and infrastructure-as-code (IaC) practices.
* Manage cloud infrastructure, including administration, account management, and cost optimization.
* Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to build and maintain cloud solutions that align with business objectives.

  


**The skills and experiences you need**
We are looking for someone who has:
* Minimum 5 years of documented experience defining new cloud architectures and leading independent projects from an architectural standpoint.
* Expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, with strong experience in Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible, etc.).
* Hands-on experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, OpenShift) and embedded CI/CD, optimizing build processes.
* Proficiency in CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, and Azure DevOps, along with scripting languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
* Deep understanding of networking, firewalls, VPNs, cloud security frameworks, and DevSecOps practices, including experience with security tools (SIEM, IDS/IPS, WAFs, vulnerability scanning, and endpoint protection).
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, coaching, and communication skills, with knowledge of third-party tools, frameworks, and modules used in software development.
* Familiarity with open-source licensing and models, with the ability to lead by example, take initiative, and collaborate across teams.


The ideal candidate is a proactive leader who takes ownership of initiatives and fosters a collaborative and mentoring approach within teams. They should have strong leadership skills, be hands-on in their work, and serve as a guiding force for cloud architecture decisions.  

**What we offer**
We are passionate about providing opportunities and benefits, so that you can continue a lifelong career with us. Here is what we have to offer:
* learning and career development opportunities, whether it is online learning, management training or enhancing your skills
* a competitive salary
* the opportunity to work with a great group of people in a dynamic and cooperative environment

  


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
Let's together create a safer and more open world!
To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: Energy Management – ML Engineer
description:
**Om tjänsten**
---------------

  

You will work as part of a team responsible for developing production ready solutions in control, steering and optimisation of flex assets; and in bringing these solutions to successful business implementation and customer operation.


In broad terms this position is responsible for core feature maintenance, monitoring and development of predictive algorithms, as well as data modelling, feature testing and performance evaluation, dashboard creations, data cleaning and insights generations.


Your primary responsibilities are to;

* Maintain & develop architecture for processing data in Azure data pipelines via Azure Databricks; Develop models & versioning using ML.
* Manage & deploy Azure Databricks inference notebooks and infrastructure for continuous retraining of machine learning models.
* Maintain & backup Databricks workspace and associated Data Lake environment.
* Second line support i.e. monitoring of forecast models and alarm/ dashboard development & integration into existing Platform Dashboards.
* Report & manage workload via Azure DevOps environment.
* Monitoring of operational costs, performance and computational requirements via Azure, to ensure a scalable and reliable system.

**Din bakgrund**
----------------

  

We are looking for an outstanding candidate to join our Energy Management team to secure our in-house competence as a Machine Learning Engineer. To suceed in this role a few years of relevant work experience are required.


Education;

* Master of science degree in a quantitative field, e.g., applied engineering; computer science; data science (or similar).


Work experience;


Key techniques, methods & processes that you must be grounded in include;

* Azure Cloud Services; Azure Functions; Azure DevOps
* Data Engineering
* Git
* ML algorithms
* MLOps
* Python Programming


Experience and demonstrable knowledge in the following would be a benefit,

* Electrical engineering, power electronics, power systems
* Optimisation theory (especially linear programming) & applied methods
* Azure Databricks Delta Lake with Spark; Unity Catalogue
* Building Azure pipelines for automatic deployments
* Creating Azure functions with APIs for callable endpoints.
* Experience in creating installable Python packages
* Automatic deployments of GIT repos to Azure Functions
* OpenAPI specification & Swagger; FastAPI web framework
* MongoDB


Meritorious;

* Certified or Accredited professional qualifications
* A portfolio of developer work


Language;


Fluent in English; proficiency in Swedish is considered a plus


Personal profile;

* As a person you are analytical, inquisitive, committed and self-driven with proven communication and interpersonal skills; You take ownership and pride in successful customer implementation and support in first commercial operation; You innovate regarding new ways of working and in developing our technical frameworks.

**Mer information**
-------------------

  

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.  

  

**Location:** Stockholm, Solna  

  

**For more information** about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Dag Wästlund Data Science & AI, +46 725 67 84 92. For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Johanna Kollander +46 70 220 92 88  

  

Trade Union representatives in Sweden via Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.  

Christer Gustafsson,ledarna, christer.gustafsson2@vattenfall.com,  

Juha Siipilehto juha.siipilehto@vattenfall.com,  

Christel Karlsson christel.karlsson@vattenfall.com.  

  

**We welcome your application in English no later than 27:th of april**. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website and that you refrain from submitting a cover letter with your application. You apply quickly and easily by answering screening questions and attaching your CV.  

  

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.  

  

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall.  

  

Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.  

  

We look forward to receiving your application!

**Om oss**
----------

  

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 21 000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.


Do you want to be a key player in taking Vattenfall forward in the emerging energy landscape?


The energy sector is undergoing revolutionary change. Digitalization and the Internet of Things opens business opportunities in new Flex solutions, such as integration of customer flex assets e.g., stationary batteries, EV charging infrastructure, facility heating, PV inverters; as well as interaction with assets on the distribution grid.


Using innovative solutions, Vattenfall R&D has group-wide responsibility for conducting business driven technical development that supports the company’s strategic focus areas.


We offer you a flexible work environment where you will have the freedom to be creative, work and develop in an exciting and rapidly changing technical field of strategic importance to the company.

title: Sofware Engineer R&D Cloud
description:
Are you ambitious and have a high personal drive? Do you want to help us digitize the heavy construction industry and contribute to a more sustainable world? We now have an opportunity for an experienced software engineer to join our cloud team in R&D at Leica Geosystems Machine Control Division in Liljeholmen, Stockholm.
  
What Does Leica Machine Control Do?
  
We develop state-of-the-art GPS guidance and automation technology for heavy construction machinery. As part of Hexagon's Geosystems division, we create software solutions that digitize and transform the construction industry. Our cloud platforms connect construction machinery, operators, and office staff in real-time, enabling better coordination and monitoring of field assets.
  
We are a global company of great diversity with employees working across the world, hence you will collaborate with colleagues in Poland, Denmark, Switzerland, and Australia, among others
  
  

**What You Will Do:**  

Build and iterate quickly on a new IoT Fleet Management platform within our Cloud Team
  
Create and maintain mission-critical cloud-based systems that integrate Leica's surveying and machine control technologies
  
Work in a strong DevOps culture, with a diverse cross-functional team to design, develop, operate, and maintain software that brings real-world value to our customers
  
Focus on delivering impactful full-stack solutions
  
Leverage AI-enabled workflows to improve efficiency and scalability
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

We value builders—people who thrive on creating, iterating, and delivering meaningful software. If you enjoy seeing your work make a real impact and believe that happiness comes from shipping great products rather than obsessing over tools, this role is for you.
  
  

**Qualifications required:**  

4+ years of experience in full-stack web development
  
Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
  
Self-sufficient, solution-oriented, and comfortable with rapid iterations
  
Fluent in written and spoken English
  
Passionate about building high-quality, impactful software
  
  

Technical Skills (we value experience, but mindset is equally important):
  
To deliver high-quality solutions, you will work across the entire stack—backend (C#/.NET, some Django/Python), frontend (Angular), and CI/CD pipelines. You will also leverage AI-enabled workflows to enhance development efficiency and scalability.
  
We are open to candidates at an intermediate or senior level; title and compensation will be commensurate with experience.
  
What we offer
  
We offer an exciting position in a company with a complete supply chain. We believe that world leading products are developed by engaged people. For this reason, Leica Geosystems strives to create an atmosphere of innovation with a talented, motivated, and engaged workforce.
  
The combination of the small office mentality with the power that comes with a strong global organization is inspiring and allows great career growth opportunities both horizontally and vertically. We enjoy social activities, offer beneficial healthcare insurance, pension provisions per collective agreement, as well as grants for wellness and parental leave. Our nice office is centrally located in Liljeholmen, Stockholm.
  
We have embraced a flexible hybrid environment as we see value in having in-office interactions alongside the ability to choose to work at home if that is where you feel the most productive. More information about Leica is available at www.leica-geosystems.com
  
Company Description
  
Leica Geosystems Machine Control is part of Hexagon’s Geosystems division. Leica Geosystems creates complete solutions for professionals in a diverse mix of industries, such as aerospace and defence, safety and security, construction, and manufacturing. With precise and accurate instruments, sophisticated software, and trusted services, Leica Geosystems delivers value every day to those shaping the future of our world. In Machine Control Division we are offering simplified and connected machine control solutions for increasing productivity, efficiency and safety in heavy construction operations.
  
Hexagon is the global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. Our solutions free our customers to harness the rapidly-increasing amounts of data, putting it to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications. Hexagon (Nasdaq Stockholm: HEXA B) has approximately 24,000 employees in 50 countries and net sales of approximately 5.2bn EUR.
  
Interested?
  
Apply using this link and upload your CV and cover letter in English. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis, and candidates may be asked to complete a case task. All applications are treated as fully confidential.
  
For questions, please contact R&D Team lead Sebastian Wassberg via LinkedIn, email or phone +46 70 600 41 28.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Your Role
  
We are looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer for a consulting assignment with our client. In this role, you will contribute to the development and maintenance of the client's cloud-based infrastructure. You will work with modern CI/CD tools, cloud services, and observability platforms to ensure seamless deployment and monitoring of applications.
  
Your Responsibilities Develop, maintain, and optimize CI/CD pipelines using TeamCity, Octopus, and GitHub Actions.
  
Manage and deploy applications in Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  
Work with logging and observability tools such as DataDog, CloudWatch, and Loggly to ensure system reliability.
  
Maintain and optimize SQL Server databases.
  
Manage containerized applications and work with CloudFormation for infrastructure automation.
  
Ensure best practices in cybersecurity and infrastructure management.
  
Qualifications
  
Experience with CI/CD tools such as TeamCity, Octopus, and GitHub Actions.
  
Strong understanding of AWS cloud services.
  
Hands-on experience with logging and observability tools.
  
Proficiency in SQL Server and database management.
  
Experience working with containers and CloudFormation.
  
Preferred Experience Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices.
  
Experience with .NET tech stack and application development.
  
Familiarity with CDK and GRPC.
  
LocationThe client's office is located in Stockholm, and hybrid work options are available.
  
Timeline & ScopeThe assignment length is 6 months with the possibility of extension.
  
Edge of TalentTransparency and Responsible AI Usage.
  
At Edge of Talent, we strive to work efficiently and professionally. Therefore, we sometimes use AI-based tools to support our administration, for example, to structure and summarize information.
  
However, we want to be clear that AI never makes decisions for us. All decisions about which candidates proceed in our processes are made by a human who carefully evaluates each candidate based on competency criteria and how these match the client's requirements specification for the role.
  
Our ambition is to ensure a fair and transparent recruitment process where all candidates are assessed based on their actual merits and experiences.

title: Senior Technical Project Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Senior Technical Project Manager
  
**Location:** Stockholm on site
  
  

**About Us:**  

We are a cutting-edge IT consulting firm with a team of highly skilled developers based in Dhaka. Our mission is to tackle complex technological challenges and deliver world-class solutions to businesses globally. We are now seeking an exceptionally talented and experienced Senior Technical Project Manager to take charge of high-stakes projects that require strategic vision, technical acumen, and flawless execution.
  
  

**Role Overview:**  

As a Senior Technical Project Manager, you will be the driving force behind the success of mission-critical software development projects. You will navigate intricate technical landscapes, orchestrate cross-functional teams, and deliver sophisticated solutions that meet and exceed business objectives. This role demands a proactive leader who thrives in high-pressure environments and is adept at managing multiple large-scale projects simultaneously.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Architect and execute complex, multi-faceted software development projects from inception to deployment.
  
  

Lead and coordinate distributed teams across multiple time zones, ensuring precision in execution and delivery.
  
  

Define and enforce rigorous project scopes, objectives, milestones, and budgets.
  
  

Identify and neutralize potential risks before they escalate, developing robust contingency plans.
  
  

Act as the primary liaison between executive stakeholders, technical teams, and clients to maintain seamless communication and alignment.
  
  

Implement and refine Agile methodologies to optimize performance, adaptability, and innovation.
  
  

Continuously evaluate project progress, making high-impact decisions to maintain efficiency and quality.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Extensive experience as a Technical Project Manager or in a comparable leadership role.
  
  

Deep understanding of advanced software development processes, DevOps practices, and Agile frameworks.
  
  

Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to navigate and resolve complex technical challenges.
  
  

Strong leadership and interpersonal skills to drive teams toward excellence under tight deadlines.
  
  

Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale, high-complexity projects.
  
  

Proficiency with project management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello, Asana) and familiarity with software engineering best practices.
  
  

Solid technical background or hands-on experience in programming, system architecture, or cloud technologies.
  
  

Fluency in English with outstanding communication skills.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

An elite team of professionals tackling cutting-edge technological challenges.
  
  

Exposure to high-impact global projects that push the boundaries of innovation.
  
  

Competitive compensation, performance-based incentives, and career growth opportunities.
  
  

Flexible remote work options within a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  
  

Continuous learning opportunities with access to top-tier industry resources.
  
  

If you have the expertise, resilience, and ambition to lead at the highest level, we want to hear from you!
  
  

**How to Apply:**  

Send your resume and a compelling cover letter to [Your Contact Email] with the subject line "Senior Technical Project Manager Application." Only the best will be considered.

title: Kubernetes Platform Engineer
description:
Conoa hjälper företag att modernisera IT-infrastruktur med fokus på Kubernetes, Cloud Native, Container-teknologi, Hybrid Cloud, IaC, CI/CD, Automatisering och DevOps.
   

  

 Linux och Open Source finns i vårt DNA, och vi utvecklas ständigt genom att dela kunskap med varandra. Vi satsar stenhårt på kompetensutveckling genom en generös utbildningsbudget, och våra medarbetare belönas för att hålla sina kunskaper i absolut framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Är du en Kubernetes-expert med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem och hjälpa kunder att bygga skalbara och pålitliga plattformar? Har du erfarenhet av både cloud- och on-prem? Om så är fallet, tror vi att du skulle passa bra i rollen som Kubernetes konsult på Conoa!
   

  

 Som Kuberneteskonsult på Conoa kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras affärsbehov och designa anpassade lösningar baserade på Kubernetes som är skalbara, pålitliga och säkra både i cloud- och on-prem miljöer.
   

  

 Du kommer dels att vara ansvarig för att utvärdera våra kunders befintliga infrastruktur, identifiera områden som kan förbättras och implementera bästa praxis för Kubernetes-distribution, hantering och optimering. Men du kommer även att kunna komma in i tidiga faser av projekt och genomföra såväl design, arkitektur och implementation. Vi rekryterar både till vårt kontor i Stockholm och i Göteborg.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Arbeta nära kunder för att förstå deras affärsbehov och designa anpassade lösningar baserade på Kubernetes.
* Utvärdera kundernas befintliga infrastruktur, identifiera områden som kan förbättras och implementera bästa praxis för Kubernetes-distribution, hantering och optimering.
* Tillhandahålla teknisk vägledning och stöd under hela projektets livscykel, från design till distribution och underhåll.
* Samarbeta med våra interna team för att säkerställa att våra lösningar är anpassade till våra kunders behov och mål.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad inom de senaste trenderna och utvecklingarna inom Kubernetes och cloudinfrastruktur.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera plattformar baserade på Kubernetes.
* Stark förståelse för containeriseringsteknologier som Docker och Podman.
* Lång erfarenhet av Linux.
* Erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg som Ansible och Terraform.
* Kännedom om cloudplattformar som AWS, Azure eller GCP, samt on-prem infrastruktur.
* Kännedom om Kubernetes-plattformar som Rancher, OpenShift och Tanzu.
* Erfarenhet av övervaknings- och loggningsverktyg som Prometheus, Grafana och ELK-stacken.
* God problemlösningsförmåga och noggrannhet.
* Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.
* Erfarenhet av arbete som konsult eller i en kundnära roll är ett plus.
* Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Om du är redo för en spännande utmaning inom och vill arbeta i ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag inom Kubernetes så har vi mycket att erbjuda. Här får du arbeta i teknikens framkant med utmaningar och projekt i moderna IT-miljöer där skalbarhet, säkerhet och automatisering är prioriterat. Du är en del av ett fantastiskt team med en varm och familjär kultur.
   

  

 På Conoa finns ett erfaret team med säljare och konsultchefer, som genom moderna arbetssätt och rätt nätverk hittar det perfekta uppdraget för dig.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i uppdrag där du utmanas och får använda din kompetens på bästa sätt. För den som vill kan detta kombineras med kortare specialistuppdrag, utbildning och workshops.
   

  

**Om Conoa**
 Conoa grundades 2012 med en stark övertygelse om att Linux och Open Source-baserade lösningar är grundbultar i modern infrastruktur. Vårt mål var att bygga ett starkt teknikfokuserat företag med en företagskultur som främjar kompetensutveckling för att ständigt vara relevanta och hjälpa företag in i nya IT-miljöer.
   

  

 2015 inleddes vår satsning inom Container-teknologi då vi blev första partner i Europa till Docker. Resan fortsatte med viktiga roller i stora kundprojekt, och att vi som första bolag i Sverige utsågs till både Kubernetes Certified Service Provider (KCSP) och Kubernetes Training Partner (KTP). Under dessa år har vi växt fram som en av Sveriges främsta specialister inom Kubernetes, Cloud Native och Container-teknologi.
   

  

 Vi har förmånen att ha ett 30-tal av Sveriges främsta specialister som medarbetare och vi hjälper några av Sveriges ledande företag att implementera modern Cloud Native infrastruktur.
