title: Data Engineer - Expereince
description:
Delivering the best Spotify experience possible. To as many people as possible. In as many moments as possible. That’s what the Experience team is all about. We use our deep understanding of consumer expectations to enrich the lives of millions of our users all over the world, bringing the music and audio they love to the devices, apps and platforms they use every day. Know what our users want? Join us and help Spotify give it to them.
   

  

 We are looking for an engaged and enthusiastic data engineer to join one of our Experience Mission teams. Our teams within the Experience Mission are responsible for all of Spotify consumer experiences across our mobile apps as well as platforms like web, TVs, speakers, cars, wearables, and partner application integrations to make Spotify available wherever our users are.
   

  

 We are hiring data engineers who are passionate about building structured, high-quality data solutions. These solutions will be used to evolve our products, bringing better experiences to Spotify users and the global artist community alike. We process petabytes of data using GCP suite such as BigQuery, Dataflow and Pub/sub. We are also known to write our own open source software to cater for our needs, such as Scio, a Scala API wrapper for Apache Beam.
   

  

 What You´ll Do
   

  

* Build large-scale batch and streaming data processing systems with Scala, and cloud platform tools.
* Collaborate with other software engineers, data scientists, and decision makers to build data powered products.
* Evolving our data pipelines towards technical excellence by improving data quality through testing, tooling and continuously evaluating performance at scale.
* Perform root cause analysis on data and processes in order to answer business questions and find opportunities for improvement.
* Continuously improve our code bases by working with innovative data processing frameworks, technologies, and platforms.
* Work in multi-functional teams with end-to-end responsibility for product development and delivery within the mission.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are knowledgeable and driven about software engineering. We use languages such as Python, Java, Scala and SQL combined with various cloud solutions. Although you might not have a background in our field, bringing knowledge and experience from other fields is merited.
* You have experience working with high volume heterogeneous data, preferably with data processing frameworks like Apache Beam, Apache Spark, Apache Flink.
* You have strong analytical skills and love to visualize your data findings in a clear and easy to understand way and to collect corner cases of implementations.
* You care deeply about agile software processes, reliability, and responsible experimentation as well as being a strong advocate for engineering best practices such as continuous integration and delivery.
* You have a proven understanding of data modeling, data access, and data storage, caching, replication, and optimization techniques.
* You understand the value of collaboration within teams. You are comfortable with asynchronous communication, being able to work independently while always sharing
* Having familiarity with and interest in backend development is a plus.


 Where You´ll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home


 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Gateway)
description:
*We are Tibber, the energy company that wants you to use less energy. Whaaat? That’s right. We’ll get back to that. Yes, we are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask? Well, a third of our employees are actually working on developing products and solutions that can help you use energy in a smarter way and at a lower cost – all with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.* 




  





*Our growth rate has been truly amazing, and still, we’re just getting started. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios trading energy on the market* 
 .
 



  





**Job Mission 🚀🚀** 




 In the Product Experience product area, we build many of the features that our customers love - from signup and onboarding to the Tibber home screen as well as all the charts and analysis, powered by consumption and behavioral data.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 We’re on a quest to find a Senior Backend Engineer for our Product Experience area. You will help us build and maintain parts of our backend, serving the apps and our customers with all the data needed in the apps. The role entails close cooperation with other Backend Engineers, App Engineers, Designers, and Data Scientists within our various product areas. Some of your responsibilities (but not limited to) include:
 


* Building and maintaining the GraphQL layer between the apps and the backend services
* Bringing new ideas to the table
* Championing your vision of what the system architecture should be
* Pushing for experimentation
* Debugging system-wide effects
* Demoing
* Keeping up with technical developments in the field



 You are not expected to juggle all the above at the same time, but you should ideally be a versatile Engineer who thrives in a scale-up environment.
 



  





**Ability to build, contribute to, and maintain relevant services and tools.** 
 You would be a key contributor - a Senior Backend Engineer cooperating closely with other Gateway Engineers. You would be integrating numerous microservices to ensure seamless data flow to the apps.
 



  





**Engineering contribution.** 
 As part of the Engineering culture here at Tibber, we always strive to further develop how we work with everything from tooling to architecture and collaboration. You’re expected to take an active part in that work and those discussions.
 



  





**Ideally you have ⚡️⚡️** 




**Tech expertise.** 
 You thrive designing, building, and maintaining software in technologies like Javascript, Typescript, Node.js, GraphQL. You are comfortable in an AWS and Kubernetes environment and with owning what you built.
 



**Microservices experience.** 
 Knowledgeable with a microservices architecture in high throughout cloud environments.
 



**App appreciation.** 
 Experience working with a customer-facing mobile app. We don’t expect you to contribute in Kotlin or Swift, but an understanding of how mobile apps work will certainly help.
 



**Adaptability.** 
 You should enjoy and understand that some things can't be done proactively. Sometimes you will need to be reactive, as we like to iterate on customer feedback and quite often ship features early to see how they are received.
 



**Industry expertise** 
 . Understanding the energy industry is a bonus.
 



**Culturally in sync.** 
 Curious and collaborative mindset with a bold yet humble approach to engineering.
 



  





**🦹🏽‍♀️👨‍🎤Get Ready For** 




**Innovation.** 
 A way to change the landscape of one of the most important industries on the planet.
 



**Growth.** 
 A possibility to learn a lot and push the barriers of what you think is possible, with the possibility to grow personally and professionally.
 



**Autonomy.** 
 An autonomous and humble culture in a scale-up adventure.
 



**Empowerment.** 
 Your voice matters, we are a place to work where laughter and support amongst diverse and inclusive colleagues are guaranteed.
 



**Flexibility.** 
 Whether this is towards health, wellness, equipment, or other allowances important to you, we will do our best to accommodate your needs. Many of us are parents and we all value a good work-life balance.
 



  





**💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️The Tibber Mindset** 




 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. Tibber is a startup in the word's true sense, which means we are on a journey of constant change. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users.
 



  





 We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
 



  





 We're very proud of being a mission-driven startup with thousands and thousands of new users every month. Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki, and with that number growing each week, we’re still just getting started. Through 2024 we will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
 



  





*At Tibber, we are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining exceptional people regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, or gender identity. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.*

title: Fullstack Developer in Quantum, Ai and Blockchain
description:
Grow with us
   

  

 Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
   

  

 Job Summary:
   

  

 Are you looking for an opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects involving blockchain, AI, and quantum computing? Do you enjoy a collaborative and innovative environment fostering rapid prototyping and experimentation with access to advanced tools and platforms for cloud-native development? Are you into career growth opportunities in a tech-forward organization? If you said yes, we might have a position for you!
   

  

 We are a team of altogether 17 people in Stockholm and Bangalore and are now seeking a dynamic and versatile Fullstack Developer to join our team in Stockholm Headquarters with expertise in developing scalable, cloud-native applications. The ideal candidate will have a passion for leveraging cutting-edge technologies like blockchain, AI, and quantum computing to drive rapid prototyping and innovation. This role demands a self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, Agile environment and can take ownership of end-to-end application development.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Fullstack Development: Build and maintain scalable web applications using Java, Spring Boot, and modern JavaScript frameworks (React/Angular).
* Blockchain Integration: Design and implement blockchain solutions, ensuring security, scalability, and performance.
* AI and Quantum Prototyping: Collaborate with AI and quantum computing teams to integrate intelligent and innovative solutions into applications.
* API Development: Develop RESTful and GraphQL APIs with secure and efficient authentication mechanisms, including PKI and certificate management.
* Cloud-Native Solutions: Build and deploy microservices using Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, and AWS-native services (API Gateway, Lambda, S3, RDS).
* Database Management: Design and optimize schemas, functions, and triggers for relational (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and NoSQL (MongoDB, InfluxDB) databases.
* DevSecOps: Ensure secure coding practices and integrate security into the CI/CD pipeline using tools like GitLab and Jira.
* UI Development: Create responsive, user-friendly UIs using React JS, HTML5, and CSS3.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with project goals and deliver rapid prototypes for evolving business needs.
* Performance Optimization: Conduct code reviews, performance tuning, and troubleshooting to ensure high-quality, efficient applications.


 Join our Team
   

  

 Required Qualifications:
   

  

* Education: Minimum master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in fullstack development.
* Languages & Frameworks: Proficiency in Java (Spring Boot, Spring Cloud), JavaScript (React, Angular) and Go Lang.
* Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with AWS cloud-native applications, serverless computing, and distributed systems (EKS, Kafka, Redis).
* Database Skills: Strong understanding of relational and NoSQL databases, with experience in schema design and performance tuning.
* Blockchain & AI: Familiarity with blockchain technologies (e.g., Ethereum, Hyperledger) and AI tools/frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Quantum Computing: Basic understanding of quantum principles and experience with prototyping solutions leveraging quantum platforms.
* DevSecOps: Experience integrating security practices into CI/CD pipelines.
* Agile Development: Proven ability to deliver in an Agile environment, using tools like Jira and GitLab.
* UI Development: Expertise in building intuitive user interfaces with modern JavaScript frameworks.


 Preferred Qualifications:
   

  

* Knowledge of big data platforms (e.g., Apache Spark, Databricks).
* Experience with Power BI and other data visualization tools.
* Strong scripting skills in Python or Shell in a Linux environment.
* Knowledge of containerization best practices and infrastructure automation.


 Skills & Competencies:
   

  

* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills to articulate technical solutions clearly.
* Strong understanding of secure coding practices and software architecture principles.
* Adaptable to rapidly changing technologies and business requirements.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Type: Full-Time
   

  

 Experience Level: Mid-Senior Level
   

  

 ]]>

title: Erfaren IT-arkitekt | Technology Consulting
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

 Vill du stötta kunder i deras digitala transformationsresa inom IT-strategi och IT-arkitektur? Har du stor passion för affärsutveckling? Ta chansen att bli en del av vårt dynamiska och växande team! Som erfaren IT-arkitekt till vårt kompetensområde Techonolgy Strategy Transformation i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö och kommer du hjälpa oss forma framtidens teknologilandskap. Tillsammans kan vi göra skillnad!
   

  

**Möjligheten:**
 Vi söker erfarna IT-arkitekter som kan analysera, designa och implementera arkitekturlandskap för att möta dagens och framtidens behov. Du kommer ha en avgörande nyckelroll som IT-arkitekt och projektledare att utforma och implementera strategier gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden:**
* Leda design av IT-arkitekturlandskap som möter kundernas behov.
* Driva implementering av teknologiska lösningar för transformation.
* Ansvara för att utvecklad arkitektur överensstämmer med affärsmål.
* Utveckla och upprätthålla arkitekturprinciper och standarder.
* Hantera risker relaterade till IT-arkitektur.
* Optimera IT-system och processer för effektivitet.
* Coacha juniora kollegor vid behov.
* Hålla sig uppdaterad om branschtrender och ny teknologi.


**Kvalifikationer för tjänsten:**
* 7+ års erfarenhet av att arbeta nära kunder i en rådgivande eller affärsutvecklande roll med fokus på IT-arkitektur.
* Dokumenterad förmåga att leda och koordinera IT-projekt från start till mål, med stark teknisk kompetens.
* Stark teknisk och analytisk förmåga för utvärdering, definition och design av komplexa IT-arkitekturer.
* Bevisad erfarenhet av att optimera mjukvaruutveckling samt tillhörande verktyg, med djup teknisk förståelse.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att skapa lösningsarkitektur för molnplattformar och genomföra molntransformationer, med gedigen teknisk kunskap.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder och teknisk implementering i sådana miljöer.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska.


**Vi ser också gärna att du…**
* Har erfarenhet av att sälja in större projekt.
* Har erfarenhet av att framgångsrikt levererat större projekt.
* Har erfarenhet och ett intresse för affärsutveckling.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med förändringsledning i komplexa miljöer.


**Vad vi erbjuder:**
* Kontinuerligt lärande: Utveckla färdigheter för framtiden.
* Framgång på ditt sätt: Verktyg och flexibilitet för att göra skillnad.
* Transformativt ledarskap: Insikter och coachning för att bli en ledare.
* Inkluderande kultur: Accepterande av den du är och möjlighet att hjälpa andra.


**Är du redo att ”Shape your future with confidence”?** 
**Ansök idag.**
 Välkommen att söka tjänsten! Vänligen skicka in din ansökan senast den 5 maj 2025. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vid frågor gällande tjänsten, kontakta Sofie Segerfors på Sofie.Segerfors@se.ey.com. Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Adrian Lyng på Adrian.Jeffersson.Lyng@se.ey.com. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
 *Observera att en bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
 På EY främjar vi en inkluderande miljö och värdesätter olikheter. Vi uppmuntrar ansökningar från kandidater med olika bakgrunder och strävar efter en rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Vid behov av stöd eller anpassningar, kontakta vårt rekryteringsteam på recruitmentsweden@se.ey.com.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: Senior Javautvecklare
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.* 




**Rollen** 




 I rollen som Senior Javautvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med moderna, skalbara och robusta system i en innovativ teknisk miljö. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll hos våra kunder i att designa, utveckla och optimera applikationer som är molnbaserade och containeriserade. 
 



 Som konsult hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med spännande uppdrag inom både den privata och offentliga sektorn. Du har möjligheten att själv påverka din tid, utveckling, lön, pension, semester och val av uppdrag, här formar du din egen framtid!
 



**Erfarenhet** 



* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av Java.
* Vana av att arbeta inom Cloud exempelvis (GCP, AWS eller Azure).
* Vana av att arbeta med containermiljö.
* Meriterande om du arbetat inom front end (JavaScript med ex Angular/Vue/React).
* God kommunikationsförmåga för att samarbeta med olika intressenter.



**Varför ska du välja oss?** 




 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
 



**Om Castra** 




 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
 



 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
 



 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
 



**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Annelie.nilsson@castra.se Tel: +46 76- 531 45 81

title: Quality Specialist
description:
Quality Specialist At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.
  
That's our story. Make it your story.
  
Your role and responsibilities
  
Do you want to help shape the future of quality within Smart Power? We are looking for a passionate Quality Specialist who is dedicated to exceeding customer expectations and ensuring sustainable operations. As a Quality Specialist, you will be the customer's voice within our local teams, providing valuable feedback to enhance the customer experience.
  
  

Act as the product quality specialist for designated product areas within Smart Power.
  
Ensure the quality level delivered to customers meets the highest standards and datasheet specifications.
  
Be responsible for supplier quality and driving continuous quality improvements with our suppliers.
  
Be accountable for manufacturing quality costs and driving continuous improvements and problem-solving.
  
Lead quality investigations on issues.
  
Be responsible for approving deviations for products and processes.
  
Be the "voice of the customer" and "voice of quality" within our organization.
  
Develop and implement quality standards to ensure consistent product quality.
  
Act on customer complaints and feedback, ensuring timely resolution and continuous improvement.
  
Perform regular quality audits to ensure compliance with internal and external standards.
  
Analyze quality data to identify trends and areas for improvement. Qualifications for the role
  
  

Have several years of experience in quality work or as an engineer.
  
Possess strong knowledge of drawings, circuit diagrams, quality methodologies and PPAP.
  
Have knowledge in Lean 6 Sigma and preferably Green Belt certification.
  
Demonstrate a collaborative, solution-focused approach and strong written and verbal communication skills.
  
Hold a Master of Science in engineering.
  
Be knowledgeable in electronics and mechanics.
  
Be fluent in English, both written and spoken.
  
Have experience with Quality Management Systems (QMS), such as ISO 9001 or IRIS.
  
Possess advanced problem-solving skills with a proven track record of solving complex quality issues.
  
Have proficiency with quality management software and tools. More about us
  
ABB Electrification Smart Power division is a global technology leader with products and solutions for power generation and automation. Supplies smart, connected, and protected. Its intelligent products and solutions make power more competitive by improving the energy efficiency, productivity, and reliability of almost any operation. Our culture is one of quality and operational excellence which is fueled and supported by our talented people, tools and processes, and our “know how.” Be part of a dynamic team that values innovation and creativity.
  
We invest in our employees' development, providing opportunities for professional growth. Contribute to delivering products that make a difference in Motor Starting & Safety.
  
  

Recruiting Manager Carl Thorstensson, +46 727 44 50 70, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Senad Huijc, +46 730 88 30 06, Unionen: Johan Lundström, +46 730 77 03 66, Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Ludvig Ahlqvist. We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.
  
  

You are welcome to apply the latest by April 16th.
  
  

We look forward to receiving your application (PDF documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Android/C++ Engineer, Client Platform
description:
Mobile
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Android/C++ engineer with a focus on architecture and platform to work on the Synchrotron squad. As our application code base continues to grow, we recognize the need for efficient source code organization and complexity management. Your role will be essential in ensuring developers can work within isolated systems, reducing cognitive load and build complexity. You will be responsible for establishing and maintaining useful building blocks to help developers and systems reason about application state and logic flow.
Location


Stockholm
Job type


Permanent
What You’ll Do

* Join a collaborative and autonomous team of engineers dedicated to improving the mobile app architecture at Spotify
* Implement and maintain isolation strategies for SEM (Software Ecosystem Model) conformance within repositories and across multiple repositories, ensuring that systems are designed to be developed and tested in isolation to improve build performance and reduce interdependencies.
* Enable seamless interoperability between Kotlin/Java and C++ within the Android codebase, leveraging modern language capabilities to enhance software development efficiency and maintainability.
* Utilize established service systems (from platform or in-house solutions) to manage application services and their lifecycles effectively, ensuring that services are robust, scalable, and maintainable.
* Guide the composition of the app by thoughtfully integrating and utilizing features and building blocks sourced from various parts of the organization, with a focus on improving product quality through foundational building blocks.
* Promote sound engineering practices, drive work on technical strategy and roadmaps.

Who You Are

* Proficiency in Android development (using Kotlin and Java) or C++ is required. Having expertise in both is a significant advantage. Candidates should demonstrate strong proficiency in at least one of these areas, along with some experience in the other, and a strong willingness to further deepen their knowledge.
* A great teammate who takes initiative and has the ability to see the bigger picture, especially when it comes to improving developer experience
* Strong understanding of software architecture and design principles
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams
* Experience with modular codebases and code isolation strategies
* Knowledge of service-oriented architecture and lifecycle management

Where You'll Be

* This role is based in Stockholm
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.

Our global benefits


Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Learn about life at Spotify


You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.


Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 500 million users.


Learn more about our culture
company_description: Passionate music fans. Innovative tech wizards. Perfect harmony. Join our band.

title: Civil/UG Field Engineer
description:
**Job Overview:**  

The CSA/UG Field Engineer uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external issues. They will act as a resource for colleagues with less experience and share their conceptual and practical expertise related to the Civil and Underground Piping discipline. They solve complex problems and use discipline-specific knowledge to improve their products or services. The CSA/UG Field Engineer impacts a range of customer, operational, project, or service activities with the site team and other related teams and ensures that they work within the appropriate guidelines and policies.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Acts as experience field engineer at the construction site in Boden, Sweden.
* Solves technical queries independently.
* Lead technical discussions with site personnel and subcontractors.
* Apply knowledge and skills to a wide range of standard and nonstandard situations.
* Prepare clear and accurate detailed design calculations and analyses, including design reports and procedures.
* Manage own time to meet agreed deadlines and budgets and develop plans for short-term work activities in own area.
* Communicate and explain complex issues and work to establish understanding.
* Initiate interface with other disciplines to obtain input for discipline designs.
* Understands details and layouts of all underground services.
* Understands hydraulic analyses and reports on calculations of underground piping designs
* Prepares Project Engineering guides for UG work.
* Coordinates and checks the work of UG engineers and designers
* Provide engineering support as required.
* Perform engineering checks of drafting.
* Perform engineering checks prepared by others within the discipline.
* Prepare MTOs of foundations and structures.
* Prepare specifications of Civil and Underground Piping.
* Prepare subcontract documents.
* Review vendor data.
* Prepare technical bid evaluations.
* Check designs for operational requirements, constructability, and maintainability.
* Tasks as Engineering Specialist, in addition:

o Perform independent computer analyses of foundations and structures.
  

o Prepare details and layouts of foundations and structures.
  

o Prepare structural analyses and reports on calculations or perform specialist tasks (i.e., architectural designs, underground piping designs, complex foundations/structures, weight control reports, the center of gravity reports)
  

o Become specialized in several fields (geotechnical, steel, concrete, dynamic calculations, FEM, fatigue calculations, earthquake, blast, architectural).
  

o Become specialized in some design codes (EC, ACI/AISC/API, GOST).
  

o Prepare project engineering guides.
Reports to: Field Engineering Manager


  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Engineering.
* 5-12 years in Oil and Gas with a major contractor or consultant, predominantly performing detail design.
* Strong working knowledge of many design techniques and analysis methods, and detailed knowledge of the content and application of standards codes and guidelines as applicable.
* Seasoned knowledge of engineering standards and specifications.
* Good knowledge of engineering software.
* Able to work independently.
* Good working knowledge of English, both oral and written.
* HSE, TQM, and cost-conscious.
* Good technical structural knowledge.
* Good organizer, motivator, and supervisor.
* Keen on improving the effectiveness of the work.
* Show flexibility and ensure proper hand-over with regards to:

o The reassignment to other departments/construction sites/fabrication yards.
  

o The replacement of colleagues during illness and holidays.
  

o The provision of assistance to other colleagues with heavy workloads (also other projects) when possible/desirable.
  

o The managing/learning of current working methods and software applications.  

#LI-RH1

title: CSA/Building Field Engineer
description:
**Job Overview:**

The CSA/Builiding Field Engineer uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external issues. They will act as a resource for colleagues with less experience and share their conceptual and practical expertise related to the Civil discipline. They solve complex problems and use discipline-specific knowledge to improve their products or services. The CSA/Builiding Field Engineer impacts a range of customer, operational, project, or service activities with the site team and other related teams and ensures that they work within the appropriate guidelines and policies.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:** 

Acts as experience field engineer at the construction site in Boden, Sweden.

title: Traction Control Engineer
description:
Req ID:469338

  


At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  



Would you like to be part of a highly skilled team and work in an empowering, international, and challenging atmosphere?


Does the opportunity to be a part of an organization that’s leading the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide, sound exciting?

  


**Join us as a Traction Control Engineer for our site in Västerås, Sweden!**

  


**Your future role**


Take on a new challenge and apply your technical expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to Manager Traction Control V&V and work alongside collaborative and dedicated team mates.

  


The main purpose of the role is to develop traction control software for high-speed trains, commuter trains and metros. You will be part of a team developing, testing and maintaining traction control software meeting customer expectations. The work will be carried out in Västerås with access to real time simulators, power lab and to trains across the world.

  


**We'll look to you for:**


* Design control software for traction systems in trains and metros
* Design, develop, document, test & integrate traction control software
* Implementation and testing using graphical programming tools such as Simulink
* Interact with neighboring disciplines within mechanical, electronics and systems engineering
* Manage requirements with internal & external stakeholders
* Participate in investigations & in the development of solutions
* Provide support to system tests, train commissioning & homologation of traction systems
* Handle source code, configuration management, packaging & releases of software

  




**All about you:**


We value passion and attitude over experience. That's why we don't expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we've listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:


* MSC in Computer Engineering, Robotics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics or equivalent.
* Drive for results, good problem-solving skills, enjoying to create software solutions together with others.
* English at a business fluent level is essential for the job and Swedish at an intermediate level is preferable.
* 2-3 years of experience of software development for industrial applications or real-time systems is an advantage.
* Experience of Simulink or similar graphical modelling and simulation tool is an advtange.
* Experience of model based design workflow and interested in developing such workflow further is an advantage.

  




**Things you will enjoy:**


* Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career.
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues.
* Contribute to innovative projects.
* Utilise our agile working environment.
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries.
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning.
* Progress towards an expert role.
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension).

  




You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Important to note**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

  

  

**Job Segment:** Testing, Technology
company_description: Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation.

title: Project Engineering Manager
description:
Req ID:466566

  


At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  


If you’re ambitious, driven and team-spirited, this is your opportunity to build a career as **Project Engineer Manager** in **Stockholm or Hässleholm, SWEDEN!**

  


Take on a new challenge and apply your technical expertise in a new cutting-edge field. You’ll report to Project Engineering Team Lead, and work alongside moivated and supportive teammates.


You'll lead and coordinate engineering activities for complex railway projects. Day-to-day, you’ll work closely with teams across the business (Engineering, Project Management, Bids, etc.), manage project schedules, budgets, resources and much more.


You’ll specifically take care of liasing with relevant stakeholders to ensure project alignment with customer requirements.

  


**We'll look to you for:**


* Lead and coordinate all aspects of the design, implementation, testing and commissioning required to deliver the scope of the engineering project so as to satisfy customer requirements while adhering to the project time plan.
* Coordinate execution of engineering activities, CCB, take decisions regarding technical issues, control against project requirements.
* Establish and maintain interfaces with other Engineering departments & with relevant functions (Project Management, System Owner, EAPD, Procurement, Operations, Sales, Bids, etc).
* Continuous optimization of Project Engineering processes/tools/behaviors by taking into account business requirements, customer needs, technical innovations, and new market conditions.
* Monitor, control and report monthly all product related aspects of the project consistent with the contract requirements and established project management procedures to attain established goals.

  

  

**All about you**


We value passion and attitude over experience. That’s why we don’t expect you to have every single skill. Instead, we’ve listed some that we think will help you succeed and grow in this role:


* Master or Bachelor of Engineering degree or equivalent work experience.
* Good system knowledge on a technical level and strong background in railway signalling (Interlocking, ATP, Metros, CBTC and/or ERTMS technologies)
* Experience in working cross-functionally.
* Easy to understand Software and Hardware, and their interconnection.
* Strong experience in planning.

  




**Things you’ll enjoy**


Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:


* Enjoy stability, challenges, and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Utilise our hybrid working environment
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension)

  




You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Important to note**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

  

  

**Job Segment:** Project Manager, Testing, Procurement, Manager, Technology, Operations, Management

title: Senior Packaging Engineer
description:
With a portfolio that includes both innovative modern brands and those with a long-standing heritage, Swedish Match offers a range of products with and without tobacco, always with the consumer in focus. At the core of what they do, there is a commitment to improve public health by offering attractive and less harmful alternatives to cigarettes.
  
  

Since November 2022, Swedish Match has been part of Philip Morris International (PMI), a global leader in science-based innovation aimed at delivering a smoke-free future. PMI is transforming its business to replace cigarettes with less harmful, smoke-free alternatives, and Swedish Match plays a key role on this journey by leading the development and commercialization of oral smokefree products such as nicotine pouches.
  
  

PMI aims to elevate consumer experience through innovative packaging design and to bring the development of new materials and technology solutions to the next level of quality, executional readiness, and delightful consumer experience.
  
  

Role & Responsibilities
  
  

In the role of Senior Packaging Engineer, you will be accountable for all stages of packaging Print & Converting (P&C) development, including planning, de-risking, accurate and timely information and technical insight to the teams, stakeholders, markets, and functions to ensure optimal decision-making and delivery. Further you will;
  
  

Achieve, in close collaboration with the Brand design team, design intent & effective cost structure by applying a high level of technical competence as a specialist in printing to the design, development and/or the implementation of complex packaging.
  
Manage relationship with suppliers on printed material development & qualification.
  
Work closely with the packaging development teams for feasibility and packing line validation of new printed materials or decoration.
  
Contribute to and execute department’s innovation, sustainability and productivity in pack print strategies ensuring performance, quality, compliance, consumer and commercial requirements are aligned and integrated to the departmental strategy.
  
  

While this position is formally part of Philip Morris International (PMI), the contract and placement will be with Swedish Match North- Europe, with an amazing office in central Stockholm, Sweden. You will be part of a truly global team and work in an international environment, collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders across multiple markets (planned traveling appx. 15%), reporting to Printing & Converting Manager in Switzerland.
  
  

Key Deliverables
  
  

Support the “360 degree” graphics and finish technology assessment as part of new packaging development, specifically on the printed material/decoration.
  
Contribute to packaging equipment specification to ensure full integration of graphical/finish elements to machine operating ranges and material specification.
  
Ensure key technical assets are available at critical milestones to enable executional readiness and for seamless transition to the deployment phase: Good to Design file / Master Printing Report / Input into design master file / Master Color Standard.
  
Partner with packaging deployment at relevant stages of the development process to ensure seamless executional and specification readiness and availability of appropriate quality standards.
  
Input to lead vendor selection (in partnership with Procurement) and provide expert resource on vendor capabilities.
  
Attend key print trials at vendors where needed, including support to the packaging deployment team during the 1st commercial print run of packaging assets.
  
Play a key cross-functional role in executional readiness, simplification and enable speed to market.
  
Understand and act as a key expert resource on regulatory and compliance requirements and specifics from a global standpoint as they relate to printed components.
  
Support when required root causes analysis in case of quality issues.
  
  

Key Experience & Qualities
  
  

You bring strong expertise in packaging materials, inks, print decoration, and finishing technologies, along with a solid foundation in pre-press processes such as file preparation, proofing, plate making, and troubleshooting. Extensive knowledge of color management techniques, including ICC profiling, color calibration, and maintaining color consistency across various substrates and printing conditions, is also essential. Further, you are a quick learner with a pragmatic, analytical, and autonomous mindset.
  
  

An understanding of the runability of printed materials on packaging lines, combined with insights into substrate and ink performance and recyclability, will be key to success in this role. Strong communication and presentation skills enable you to collaborate and influence effectively across all levels of the organization and with external suppliers. This is further supported by proven risk assessment and problem-solving capabilities, as well as demonstrated leadership skills.
  
  

Minimum 6-8 years of experience ideally with a focus in Flexo, offset and digital printing, including color management, pre-press processes, and solving on-press issues. Demonstrated experience in printing on self-adhesive materials, ensuring high-quality output and adherence to specifications
  
Fluent in English. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus.
  
**Computer skills/Software:** Adobe Suite, Product Lifecycle Management tools, MS Office, CAD.
  
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent advanced studies in engineering, printing, converting, material science, or a related field.
  
  

Application
  
  

In this important and exciting recruitment, PMI/Swedish Match are partnering with Academic Search, a leading expert in Executive Search, Recruitment and Interim Management. For more information about the position, please contact Research Manager Betty Thoresson betty.thoresson@academicsearch.se.
  
  

Apply through the link below to play a pivotal role in PMI’s continued success story!
  
  

All information is handled confidentially in accordance with Academic Search Integrity Policy as well as the data protection act, GDPR. This means that we can only process applications with CV’s coming through the applications system. Please apply to the position as soon as possible, as we are interviewing on an ongoing basis. Thanks for your understanding!
  
  

Work with proud and driven colleagues
  
  

Benefits that make a difference in everyday life
  
  

Fair, market-based salary
  
  

Be part of a responsible company
  
  

International career opportunities
  
  

New skills development plan every year
  
  

Swedish Match develops, manufactures and sells well-known brands of the highest quality in the Smokeless Products and Lights segments. With a flexible, innovative, and sustainable approach, we are working for having the right strategy, people, competences, products and structure in place to quickly meet changing market conditions. We want to maximize enjoyment of our products by minimizing the carbon footprint. With a portfolio of modern brands and brands with a long tradition, Swedish Match offers products both with and without tobacco that meet market demand. Offering tobacco consumers alternatives to cigarettes is at the heart of what we are doing.
  
  

That's why we who work at Swedish Match are proud to work here – because together we make a difference!
  
  

Betty Thoresson | Contact Person

title: Electronics Engineer to Production Electronics
description:
Job Title
Electronics Engineer to Production Electronics
Job Description
We are now looking for an experienced Electronics Engineer to join the Electronics team within the Production Systems Hardware group in Lund.  

Who Is your future team?
In the production system hardware group we develop the hardware for new unique Axis production machines from concept to verified product. By each new generation of Axis network cameras new challenges occurs for our production systems. For example more advance optics and audio as well as new features such as radar and thermal technologies that are built into the cameras.
The Electronics team contains of four dedicated electronics engineers specialized in developing electronics and electrical systems for production systems.  

What you will do here as an Electronics Engineer  

You will actively be involved in development projects with a focus on simplicity, scalability, repeatability, and quality for optimal production setup. You will be part of cross functional project teams with other competence categories like software and mechanics. You will develop the electrical design and you will verify and validate the solution. Additionally, you will collaborate and have a close communication with Axis R&D department, suppliers, and our contracts manufacturers.  

The role includes:* Electrical design of machines for the production of Axis products
* Building and ordering prototypes for evaluation purposes
* PCBA Electronics schematic design for circuit boards for some of our machines
* Soldering and other practical work tasks on our prototypes
* The role may include travelling, mainly to our contract manufacturers, for approximately 10-20 days a year.

  

Who are you?  

Are you a structured and driven person with a natural engagement to finalize your deliverables? Do you like to work in a cross functional set up with an open mindset and ability to further develop a creative environment around you? Are you stimulated by challenges and love to solve problems together with others? You are not afraid to help with some practical work when needed? The role gives a wide range of interfaces and abilities to gain knowledge in different areas.
If you are curious, innovative, like to communicate and influence others with emphasis on production engineering, then we believe this is the place for you.  

Qualifications and Experience:* At least a bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering or similar is required
* At least 3 years experience of Electrical design for machines and systems is required
* Experience of the Eplan ECAD program is preferred
* International Production experience or development of production equipment as well as optics or metrology experience is considered an advantage
* Very good communication skills in English are required
* Good communication skills in Swedish are preferred
* Knowledge of CE marking is preferred

  

Ready to act?
If you have questions don’t hesitate to contact Torbjörn Karlelid (Line manager) or Kajsa Binder (Team leader) on +46 46 272 18 00.
Applications will be evaluated on an ongoing basis
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-04-22*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Quality Engineer
description:
Bertin Exensor is a world-leading supplier of tactical Unattended Ground Sensors (UGS) and we provide complete solutions for the classification and identification of potential threats on the ground. Our systems incorporate the latest sensor technology as well as cameras with motion detection. Complete solutions can also include mast-mounted cameras, radar systems and specialized long-range cameras. Our systems are constantly being developed and are at the absolute international forefront. To date, the systems have been delivered to more than 20 nations and are used in both civilian and military applications. Bertin Exensor is a dynamic company with an international working environment and corporate culture in an exciting phase of growth, with great opportunities for individual development.

**Description du poste**
------------------------

**Do you like to ensure and improve quality?** Do you have experience with ISO 9001 or other ISO standards? Do you want to work with the harmonization of different management systems, create and improve processes and procedures, checking and ensuring the quality requirements of products and components etc.?


We are currently looking for Bertin Exensor, the Sweeden subsidiary of Bertin Technologies a **Quality Engineer**!


Bertin Exensor is facing a fantastic growth journey and is therefore creating new positions to strengthen the organization. We are looking for a Quality Engineer who has a great interest in working with processes and procedures, is structured, service-oriented and has good communication skills. When the organization grows as fast as we do, it requires that our processes and procedures are stable, up-to-date and followed by the staff.


As a Quality Engineer, you will be responsible for the coordination and application of processes, procedures and templates, communicating and supporting other colleagues, ensuring compliance with requirements and standards, and contributing to the development of quality work in the company, to achieve our quality objectives.


You will, among other things, work with deviation management, quality control of finished products and components, follow-up of key figures, documentation management and audits in close cooperation with production, technology and service in Lund and the production in Basingstoke in England.


Furthermore, you will participate in the harmonization of our management system (QMS) with the group’s management system (QSEMS), develop, renew and improve our processes, as well as follow-up with involved stakeholders.

**Main tasks:**

* Responsible for deviation management, from registration, follow-up of actions, to closure of the deviations
* Convene and coordinate non-conformities through meetings with relevant stakeholders
* Responsible for and perform visual quality checks on products and components
* Ensure correct application of processes, procedures and templates
* Coordinate the quality and improvement work
* Monitor safety, quality, environmental and supplier key performance indicators
* Actively participate in internal and external audits
* Register the release of software versions to England in collaboration with Engineering team


You report to the Quality Manager. The position is based in Lund, and is time-limited to 1 year, with the possibility of extension.

**Profil recherché**
--------------------

**Your profile**


We are looking for a person with at least a couple of years of experience of working with quality and quality management systems, based on ISO 9001, preferably both administratively and practically closely linked to production and electronics manufacturing. You probably have a technical interest and are used to supporting colleagues in the quality area. You have experience with various quality tools or Lean manufacturing. Experience in environmental and sustainability issues or ISO 14001 would be an advantage.

**Personality**


You are an analytical, structured and methodical person, driven by challenges and problem solving. To fit into the culture, we believe you will have good communication skills, are collaborative, service-oriented and unpretentious.

**Bertin Exensor offers**


Bertin Exensor offers you an interesting opportunity to join our growth journey. There is a lot going on and the days rarely look the same. Periodically there can be a lot to do, but then there is a large portion of team spirit, where everyone helps to achieve our common goals.


Bertin Exensor has strong growth and shows good profitability and with a strong international owner, a bright future is predicted. The community is strong and allows us to have fun along the way. We stay in modern premises and carry out common activities together.

**Information and application**


Selection is ongoing, so we would like you to send your application immediately. A background checks will be conducted.


We are looking for an ambitious and entrepreneurial mindset who wants to join a dynamic company and to be part of our success story on the US market.


Finally, do you share our core values of courage, trust, talent, and teamwork?

**If so, don’t hesitate and apply to join us!**

title: Principal Application Engineer (Palladium Emulation)
description:
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.
Cadence is a pivotal leader in electronic design, building upon more than 30 years of computational software expertise. The company applies its underlying Intelligent System Design strategy to deliver software, hardware and IP that turn design concepts into reality.
Cadence customers are the world’s most innovative companies, delivering extraordinary electronic products from chips to boards to systems for the most dynamic market applications including consumer, hyperscale computing, 5G communications, automotive, aerospace industrial and health.
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.
Job Title: Principal Application Engineer (Palladium Emulation)
Locations: Stockholm, Helsinki, Bracknell, Edinburgh
Reports to: AE Group Director
Job Overview:
Cadence Design Systems is looking for a candidate to be part of its emulation application engineering team. If you like to architect and develop solutions for challenging problems in a fast and innovative paced environment, using state of the art technology then this is a great opportunity for you.
As an integral member of the emulation application engineering team, you will work with industry leading semiconductor and system companies to deploy Cadence’s market leading Palladium emulation platform.
You will work with the EMEA based AE and sales teams to provide technical support in the Pre and Post-Sales process.
Job Responsibilities:* Provide technical support for the deployment of Cadence’s market leading Cadence Palladium platform.
* Establish technical credibility and rapport with the customer and become the go-to expert for all of their technical inquiries and support.
* Working with the various Cadence sales teams and product developers to develop innovative solutions to address customer’s challenging problems.
* Provide proactive support and problem consultation to make our product users successful.
* Collaborate with R&D to introduce new emulation flows and solutions to customers.
* Champion customer needs and help R&D to develop competitive and creative technical solutions.
* Understand the competitive landscape and continuously work on differentiating Cadence’s solutions.
* Foster a collaborative, team-oriented, work environment.
* Represent Cadence at technical conferences and trade shows.
* Deliver training course for emulation.
* Lead projects and initiatives.


Job Qualifications:* BEng in Electronic / Micro-Electronic Engineering or Computer Science – or equivalent.
* Experience in using emulation and FPGA prototyping.
* Embedded software development and HW/SW codesign and coverification.
* Experience of Hardware Design and Verification languages including PSL, SVA, Verilog, VHDL, System Verilog, System-C, TLM.
* Experience of the IP/ Soc verification process.
* Experience with Unix / Linux environment including scripting languages.
* Good Communication and presenting skills.


Additional Information:
Cadence is committed to equal employment opportunity and employment equity throughout all levels of the organization. We strive to attract a qualified and diverse candidate pool and encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Travel: The position will include travel to customer sites and involve significant interaction with customers.
We’re doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can’t.
company_description: Cadence Design Systems, Inc (NASDAQ: CDNS) is an American electronic design automation (EDA) software and engineering services company.

title: Gameplay Engineer
description:
As a Gameplay Engineer, you will join a small team and collaborate closely with some of the most talented developers in the industry to craft something truly special.
   

  

 We believe that great games are made in creative environments where builds are always playable and teams can move fast and test as many ideas as possible. We iterate quickly and encourage experimentation. You will work in close collaboration with our designers and to create the systems and tools we need to realize that environment.
   

  

 The games we're making are built in Unreal Engine with C++ and Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Work with designers and engineers to bring innovative gameplay ideas to life
* Prototype, iterate, and help shape the gameplay experience
* Take a "gameplay-first" approach, ensuring technical decisions enhance the player experience


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A good grasp of what good gameplay looks and feels like
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft
* A problem-solving mindset and willingness to work in an iterative, fast-moving environment
* Fluent in English - our team comes from all over the world!


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Experience working on multiplayer games or shooters
* Experience working with Unreal Engine
* Ability to speak "design"
* A deep passion for games with significant hands-on experience as a player
* The ability to draw from personal gameplay experiences when developing


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
